body_html: Did a bit more digging and it seems that tooling is fine. Basically fb internal diff landed on 3/7 afternoon (adding the c10 folder), and the github PR landed 3/7 night (strictly speaking 3/8), and because the PR added and then deleted the c10 folder during the discussion, the final landing was not aware of the c10 folder situation at all in the single squash and merge. And as a result, it was basically that a dangling c10 folder need manual deletion - sync script itself is correct.

body: Did a bit more digging and it seems that tooling is fine. Basically fb internal diff landed on 3/7 afternoon (adding the c10 folder), and the github PR landed 3/7 night (strictly speaking 3/8), and because the PR added and then deleted the c10 folder during the discussion, the final landing was not aware of the c10 folder situation at all in the single squash and merge. And as a result, it was basically that a dangling c10 folder need manual deletion - sync script itself is correct.
